author: Joe Queenan
title: Animals Just Can’t Bear Life Without Copyrights
text:
In a blow to enterprising primates everywhere, a federal appellate court has just ruled that animals have no legal right to ownership of selfies.
The court, the Journal reported, was ruling on a 2015 suit brought by People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals against a wildlife photographer, saying he shouldn’t own a group of selfies snapped four years earlier by a cheeky Indonesian monkey called Naruto. PETA argued that Naruto, who apparently borrowed the photographer’s camera when he left it unattended, owned the copyright...
